designScenario.name: Fuel System
designScenario.description: An advanced aeronautical fuel management system engineered to optimize storage, distribution, and combustion efficiency across all flight regimes. Incorporates adaptive pressure control, real-time contamination detection, and thermal management to meet modern aviation demands. Designed with fail-operational architecture to comply with DO-178C and DO-254 standards for safety-critical systems.

details.description: The system must automatically adjust fuel flow rates between 50-500 GPH (gallons per hour) based on engine thrust requirements, altitude variations, and aerodynamic loading.
Multi-stage centrifugal pumps must maintain 5-8 Bar line pressure with ±2% stability during supersonic transitions and high-G maneuvers.
Integrated emergency dump system capable of jettisoning 40% of total fuel load within 8 minutes while maintaining aircraft CG (center of gravity) limits.
All wetted components must demonstrate 10,000-hour service life in JP-8 fuel environment per MIL-STD-810H corrosion standards.

systemComponents.name: Composite Fuel Cell
systemComponents.description: Lightweight self-sealing fuel bladder with integral surge protection and ballistic tolerance, constructed from hybrid polymer-nanoclay composites.

subComponents.name: Slosh Baffle System
subComponents.description: 3D-printed titanium wave-reduction baffles minimizing fuel slosh during turbulent conditions

subComponents.name: Dielectric Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Capacitive fuel quantity measurement system with ±0.5% accuracy across -40°C to 80°C operational range

systemComponents.name: Variable Displacement Pump
systemComponents.description: Electro-hydrostatic fuel pressurization unit with dual-wound brushless motors and dynamic flow compensation.

subComponents.name: Pressure Relief Cartridge
subComponents.description: Piezoelectric-controlled relief valve with 0.1ms response time for surge suppression

subComponents.name: Magnetic Coupling
subComponents.description: Hermetically sealed drive system eliminating rotating shaft seals

systemComponents.name: Fuel Control Unit
systemComponents.description: FADEC-integrated (Full Authority Digital Engine Control) metering module with MIL-STD-704F power quality compliance.

subComponents.name: Fuel Flow Servovalve
subComponents.description: Moog-style direct-drive metering valve with 12-bit resolution flow control

subComponents.name: Crystal-Free RF Transceiver
subComponents.description: SAE AS6802-compliant network interface for deterministic fuel data transmission

systemComponents.name: Phase Separation Detector
systemComponents.description: Laser-based optical analyzer detecting water/fuel emulsions and microbial growth in real-time

systemComponents.name: Cryogenic Cooling Jacket
systemComponents.description: Regenerative cooling system maintaining fuel temperature below 45°C during high-Mach operation

subComponents.name: Vapor Cycle Chiller
subComponents.description: R-134a refrigerant-based heat exchanger with 15kW cooling capacity

relationships.description: Pump operation requires minimum 0.5 Bar positive pressure from fuel cell header space to prevent cavitation
Digital twin-based predictive control linking pump speed to FCU demand signals
Integrated cooling channels form structural part of fuel cell end caps
Optical probe array samples fuel from multiple cell quadrants for contamination analysis
FCU requires real-time water content data to adjust combustion parameters

attributes.name: fuelFlashPoint
attributes.description: Minimum autoignition temperature for stored fuel per FAA TSO-C153b

attributes.name: thermalEfficiency
attributes.description: Regenerative cooling system effectiveness during supersonic cruise

attributes.name: jettisonRate
attributes.description: Emergency fuel dump capacity with dual redundant dump valves

attributes.name: vaporPressure
attributes.description: Maintained fuel vapor pressure envelope to prevent cavitation or vapor lock

attributes.name: filtrationLevel
attributes.description: Multi-stage filtration with coalescer elements meeting SAE ARP9013A

comments.body: Main fuel delivery system must maintain positive pressure at all times
